name: GitHub Actions Fundamentals
description: Master GitHub Actions basics including workflows, events, jobs, and steps for automated CI/CD

definitions.beginner: GitHub Actions is a CI/CD platform that automates software workflows directly in your GitHub repository. It allows you to build, test, and deploy your code automatically when certain events occur, like pushing code or creating pull requests.
definitions.advanced: GitHub Actions is a comprehensive automation platform providing event-driven workflows with YAML-based configuration. It features a distributed runner architecture, extensive marketplace ecosystem, matrix build strategies, and integration with GitHub's security and deployment features for enterprise-grade CI/CD pipelines.

examples.description: Comprehensive GitHub Actions workflow for Node.js application with testing, building, and deployment
examples.code:
# Complete CI/CD Workflow for Node.js Application
# .github/workflows/ci-cd.yml

name: CI/CD Pipeline

# Workflow triggers
on:
  # Trigger on push to main and develop branches
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
    paths-ignore:
      - '**.md'
      - 'docs/**'
  
  # Trigger on pull requests to main
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]
    types: [opened, synchronize, reopened]
  
  # Manual trigger with inputs
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      environment:
        description: 'Deployment environment'
        required: true
        default: 'staging'
        type: choice
        options:
          - staging
          - production
      skip_tests:
        description: 'Skip test execution'
        required: false
        type: boolean
        default: false
  
  # Scheduled runs (daily at 2 AM UTC)
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'

# Global environment variables
env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io
  IMAGE_NAME: ${{ github.repository }}

# Workflow permissions
permissions:
  contents: read
  packages: write
  security-events: write
  actions: read

jobs:
  # Job 1: Code Quality and Security
  quality-check:
    name: Code Quality & Security
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0  # Full history for SonarCloud
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
          cache-dependency-path: package-lock.json
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          npm ci --prefer-offline --no-audit
          npm list --depth=0
      
      - name: Lint code
        run: |
          npm run lint
          npm run lint:format
      
      - name: Type checking
        run: npm run type-check
        if: hashFiles('tsconfig.json') != ''
      
      - name: Security audit
        run: |
          npm audit --audit-level moderate
          npx audit-ci --moderate
      
      - name: License compliance check
        run: npx license-checker --production --onlyAllow 'MIT;Apache-2.0;BSD-2-Clause;BSD-3-Clause;ISC'
      
      - name: Dependency vulnerability scan
        uses: github/dependency-review-action@v3
        if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'

  # Job 2: Automated Testing
  test:
    name: Test Suite
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: quality-check
    if: ${{ !inputs.skip_tests }}
    
    strategy:
      matrix:
        node-version: ['16', '18', '20']
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest, macos-latest]
        include:
          - node-version: '18'
            os: ubuntu-latest
            coverage: true
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js ${{ matrix.node-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }}
          cache: 'npm'
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      
      - name: Run unit tests
        run: |
          npm run test:unit -- --coverage=${{ matrix.coverage && 'true' || 'false' }}
        env:
          NODE_ENV: test
          CI: true
      
      - name: Run integration tests
        run: npm run test:integration
        env:
          NODE_ENV: test
          DATABASE_URL: postgresql://test:test@localhost:5432/test_db
      
      - name: Upload coverage reports
        if: matrix.coverage
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
        with:
          file: ./coverage/lcov.info
          flags: unittests
          name: codecov-umbrella
          fail_ci_if_error: true
      
      - name: Upload test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: test-results-${{ matrix.node-version }}-${{ matrix.os }}
          path: |
            test-results.xml
            coverage/
          retention-days: 7

  # Job 3: Build and Package
  build:
    name: Build Application
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [quality-check, test]
    outputs:
      version: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
      image-digest: ${{ steps.build.outputs.digest }}
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'npm'
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci --production
      
      - name: Generate version
        id: version
        run: |
          if [[ "${{ github.ref }}" == "refs/heads/main" ]]; then
            VERSION=$(npm version --no-git-tag-version patch)
          else
            VERSION=$(npm version --no-git-tag-version prerelease --preid=dev)
          fi
          echo "version=${VERSION}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "Generated version: ${VERSION}"
      
      - name: Build application
        run: |
          npm run build
          npm run build:docs
        env:
          NODE_ENV: production
          VERSION: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
      
      - name: Create deployment package
        run: |
          mkdir -p dist
          tar -czf dist/app-${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}.tar.gz \
            --exclude='node_modules' \
            --exclude='.git' \
            --exclude='coverage' \
            --exclude='*.log' \
            .
      
      - name: Upload build artifacts
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: build-artifacts
          path: |
            dist/
            build/
            package.json
            package-lock.json
          retention-days: 30
      
      - name: Log in to Container Registry
        if: github.event_name != 'pull_request'
        uses: docker/login-action@v3
        with:
          registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
          username: ${{ github.actor }}
          password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      
      - name: Extract metadata
        id: meta
        uses: docker/metadata-action@v5
        with:
          images: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}
          tags: |
            type=ref,event=branch
            type=ref,event=pr
            type=semver,pattern={{version}},value=${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
            type=raw,value=latest,enable={{is_default_branch}}
      
      - name: Build and push Docker image
        id: build
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: .
          push: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' }}
          tags: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
          labels: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.labels }}
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max
          build-args: |
            VERSION=${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
            BUILD_DATE=${{ github.event.head_commit.timestamp }}
            VCS_REF=${{ github.sha }}

  # Job 4: Security Scanning
  security:
    name: Security Scanning
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    if: github.event_name != 'pull_request'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
        uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
        with:
          image-ref: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}:${{ github.sha }}
          format: 'sarif'
          output: 'trivy-results.sarif'
      
      - name: Upload Trivy scan results
        uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
        with:
          sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'
      
      - name: CodeQL Analysis
        uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
        with:
          languages: javascript

  # Job 5: Deploy to Staging
  deploy-staging:
    name: Deploy to Staging
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build, security]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' || inputs.environment == 'staging'
    environment:
      name: staging
      url: https://staging.example.com
    
    steps:
      - name: Download build artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: build-artifacts
          path: ./artifacts
      
      - name: Deploy to staging
        run: |
          echo "Deploying version ${{ needs.build.outputs.version }} to staging"
          # Deployment script would go here
          echo "Deployment completed successfully"
      
      - name: Run smoke tests
        run: |
          npm install -g newman
          newman run tests/postman/staging-smoke-tests.json \
            --environment tests/postman/staging.env.json \
            --reporters cli,junit \
            --reporter-junit-export smoke-test-results.xml
      
      - name: Upload smoke test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: smoke-test-results
          path: smoke-test-results.xml

  # Job 6: Deploy to Production
  deploy-production:
    name: Deploy to Production
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build, security]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' || inputs.environment == 'production'
    environment:
      name: production
      url: https://example.com
    
    steps:
      - name: Download build artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: build-artifacts
          path: ./artifacts
      
      - name: Create GitHub Release
        uses: actions/create-release@v1
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        with:
          tag_name: ${{ needs.build.outputs.version }}
          release_name: Release ${{ needs.build.outputs.version }}
          body: |
            ## Changes in this Release
            - Automated release from commit ${{ github.sha }}
            - Docker image: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}:${{ needs.build.outputs.version }}
            
            ## Deployment Information
            - Build ID: ${{ github.run_id }}
            - Commit: ${{ github.sha }}
            - Actor: ${{ github.actor }}
          draft: false
          prerelease: false
      
      - name: Deploy to production
        run: |
          echo "Deploying version ${{ needs.build.outputs.version }} to production"
          # Production deployment script
          echo "Production deployment completed successfully"
      
      - name: Notify deployment
        uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
        with:
          status: ${{ job.status }}
          channel: '#deployments'
          message: |
            ðŸš€ Production deployment completed!
            Version: ${{ needs.build.outputs.version }}
            Commit: ${{ github.sha }}
            Actor: ${{ github.actor }}
        env:
          SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK }}
        if: always()

  # Job 7: Cleanup
  cleanup:
    name: Cleanup
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [deploy-staging, deploy-production]
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Clean up old artifacts
        run: |
          echo "Cleaning up old build artifacts and cache"
          # Cleanup logic would go here
      
      - name: Update deployment status
        run: |
          echo "Workflow completed with status: ${{ job.status }}"
          echo "All jobs status:"
          echo "Quality Check: ${{ needs.quality-check.result }}"
          echo "Test: ${{ needs.test.result }}"
          echo "Build: ${{ needs.build.result }}"
          echo "Security: ${{ needs.security.result }}"
          echo "Deploy Staging: ${{ needs.deploy-staging.result }}"
          echo "Deploy Production: ${{ needs.deploy-production.result }}"

# Advanced Workflow Events and Triggers
# .github/workflows/events-demo.yml

name: Workflow Events Demo

# 1. PUSH EVENTS - Triggered on code pushes
on:
  push:
    # Specific branches
    branches:
      - main
      - develop
      - 'release/*'    # Wildcard pattern
      - 'hotfix/**'    # Nested wildcard
    
    # Exclude branches
    branches-ignore:
      - 'experimental/*'
      - 'archive/*'
    
    # Specific paths
    paths:
      - 'src/**'
      - 'tests/**'
      - 'package.json'
      - 'Dockerfile'
    
    # Exclude paths
    paths-ignore:
      - '**.md'
      - 'docs/**'
      - '.github/workflows/other.yml'
    
    # Specific tags
    tags:
      - 'v*.*.*'      # Semantic version tags
      - 'release-*'   # Release tags
    
    # Exclude tags
    tags-ignore:
      - 'v*-alpha'
      - 'v*-beta'

---
# 2. PULL REQUEST EVENTS
name: Pull Request Workflow

on:
  pull_request:
    # PR activity types
    types:
      - opened          # PR created
      - synchronize     # New commits pushed
      - reopened        # PR reopened
      - ready_for_review # Draft -> Ready
      - review_requested # Reviewer assigned
    
    # Target branches
    branches:
      - main
      - develop
    
    # Source branches
    branches:
      - 'feature/*'
      - 'bugfix/*'
    
    # File changes
    paths:
      - 'src/**'
      - 'tests/**'

  # Pull request reviews
  pull_request_review:
    types:
      - submitted       # Review submitted
      - edited         # Review edited
      - dismissed      # Review dismissed

  # Pull request review comments
  pull_request_review_comment:
    types:
      - created
      - edited
      - deleted

jobs:
  pr-validation:
    name: PR Validation
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout PR
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          ref: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}
      
      - name: PR Information
        run: |
          echo "PR Number: ${{ github.event.number }}"
          echo "PR Title: ${{ github.event.pull_request.title }}"
          echo "PR Author: ${{ github.event.pull_request.user.login }}"
          echo "Source Branch: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.ref }}"
          echo "Target Branch: ${{ github.event.pull_request.base.ref }}"
          echo "PR State: ${{ github.event.pull_request.state }}"
          echo "Is Draft: ${{ github.event.pull_request.draft }}"
      
      - name: Changed Files
        id: changes
        uses: dorny/paths-filter@v2
        with:
          filters: |
            src:
              - 'src/**'
            tests:
              - 'tests/**'
            docs:
              - '**.md'
              - 'docs/**'
            config:
              - '*.json'
              - '*.yml'
              - '*.yaml'
      
      - name: Run tests if source changed
        if: steps.changes.outputs.src == 'true'
        run: npm test
      
      - name: Validate docs if changed
        if: steps.changes.outputs.docs == 'true'
        run: npm run docs:validate

---
# 3. ISSUE EVENTS
name: Issue Management

on:
  issues:
    types:
      - opened
      - edited
      - closed
      - reopened
      - assigned
      - unassigned
      - labeled
      - unlabeled
  
  issue_comment:
    types:
      - created
      - edited
      - deleted

jobs:
  issue-automation:
    name: Issue Automation
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Auto-label issues
        if: github.event.action == 'opened'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const issue = context.payload.issue;
            const labels = [];
            
            // Auto-label based on content
            if (issue.title.toLowerCase().includes('bug')) {
              labels.push('bug');
            }
            if (issue.title.toLowerCase().includes('feature')) {
              labels.push('enhancement');
            }
            if (issue.body.includes('<!-- priority: high -->')) {
              labels.push('priority:high');
            }
            
            if (labels.length > 0) {
              await github.rest.issues.addLabels({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: issue.number,
                labels: labels
              });
            }
      
      - name: Assign to project
        if: github.event.action == 'labeled'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const label = context.payload.label.name;
            if (label === 'bug') {
              // Add to bug triage project
              console.log('Adding issue to bug triage project');
            }

---
# 4. SCHEDULED EVENTS
name: Scheduled Tasks

on:
  schedule:
    # Every day at 2 AM UTC
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'
    # Every Monday at 9 AM UTC
    - cron: '0 9 * * MON'
    # Every 15 minutes (for monitoring)
    - cron: '*/15 * * * *'
    # First day of every month
    - cron: '0 0 1 * *'

jobs:
  daily-maintenance:
    name: Daily Maintenance
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Cleanup old branches
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const { data: branches } = await github.rest.repos.listBranches({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo
            });
            
            for (const branch of branches) {
              if (branch.name.startsWith('feature/') && 
                  new Date() - new Date(branch.commit.commit.author.date) > 30 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000) {
                console.log(`Deleting old branch: ${branch.name}`);
                // await github.rest.git.deleteRef({
                //   owner: context.repo.owner,
                //   repo: context.repo.repo,
                //   ref: `heads/${branch.name}`
                // });
              }
            }
      
      - name: Update dependencies
        run: |
          npm audit
          npm outdated
          # Automated dependency updates could go here

---
# 5. REPOSITORY EVENTS
name: Repository Events

on:
  # New releases
  release:
    types:
      - published
      - created
      - edited
      - deleted
  
  # Stars and forks
  watch:
    types: [started]
  
  fork:
  
  # Wiki changes
  gollum:
  
  # Repository settings
  repository:
    types:
      - created
      - deleted
      - archived
      - unarchived
      - publicized
      - privatized

jobs:
  repository-events:
    name: Repository Events Handler
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Handle release
        if: github.event_name == 'release'
        run: |
          echo "Release event: ${{ github.event.action }}"
          echo "Release tag: ${{ github.event.release.tag_name }}"
          echo "Release name: ${{ github.event.release.name }}"
      
      - name: New star notification
        if: github.event_name == 'watch'
        run: |
          echo "New star from: ${{ github.event.sender.login }}"
          # Could send notification to team chat
      
      - name: New fork notification
        if: github.event_name == 'fork'
        run: |
          echo "Repository forked by: ${{ github.event.forkee.owner.login }}"
          echo "Fork URL: ${{ github.event.forkee.html_url }}"

---
# 6. WORKFLOW DISPATCH (Manual Triggers)
name: Manual Workflow

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      environment:
        description: 'Environment to deploy to'
        required: true
        default: 'staging'
        type: choice
        options:
          - development
          - staging
          - production
      
      version:
        description: 'Version to deploy'
        required: false
        default: 'latest'
        type: string
      
      run_tests:
        description: 'Run tests before deployment'
        required: false
        default: true
        type: boolean
      
      debug_mode:
        description: 'Enable debug logging'
        required: false
        default: false
        type: boolean
      
      notification_channel:
        description: 'Slack channel for notifications'
        required: false
        default: '#deployments'
        type: string

jobs:
  manual-deployment:
    name: Manual Deployment
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Display inputs
        run: |
          echo "Environment: ${{ inputs.environment }}"
          echo "Version: ${{ inputs.version }}"
          echo "Run tests: ${{ inputs.run_tests }}"
          echo "Debug mode: ${{ inputs.debug_mode }}"
          echo "Notification channel: ${{ inputs.notification_channel }}"
      
      - name: Run tests
        if: ${{ inputs.run_tests }}
        run: |
          echo "Running tests..."
          npm test
      
      - name: Deploy
        run: |
          echo "Deploying version ${{ inputs.version }} to ${{ inputs.environment }}"
          if [[ "${{ inputs.debug_mode }}" == "true" ]]; then
            echo "Debug mode enabled"
            export DEBUG=true
          fi
          # Deployment logic here

---
# 7. WORKFLOW CALL (Reusable Workflows)
name: Reusable Workflow

on:
  workflow_call:
    inputs:
      node-version:
        required: false
        type: string
        default: '18'
      
      environment:
        required: true
        type: string
    
    secrets:
      deploy-key:
        required: true
      
      notification-webhook:
        required: false
    
    outputs:
      deployment-url:
        description: 'URL of deployed application'
        value: ${{ jobs.deploy.outputs.url }}

jobs:
  deploy:
    name: Deploy Application
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      url: ${{ steps.deploy.outputs.url }}
    
    steps:
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ inputs.node-version }}
      
      - name: Deploy
        id: deploy
        run: |
          echo "Deploying to ${{ inputs.environment }}"
          # Deployment logic
          echo "url=https://${{ inputs.environment }}.example.com" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
      
      - name: Notify
        if: ${{ secrets.notification-webhook }}
        run: |
          curl -X POST ${{ secrets.notification-webhook }} \
            -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
            -d '{"text": "Deployment to ${{ inputs.environment }} completed"}'

---
# 8. CONDITIONAL WORKFLOWS
name: Conditional Execution

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  determine-changes:
    name: Determine Changes
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      frontend: ${{ steps.changes.outputs.frontend }}
      backend: ${{ steps.changes.outputs.backend }}
      docs: ${{ steps.changes.outputs.docs }}
    
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - uses: dorny/paths-filter@v2
        id: changes
        with:
          filters: |
            frontend:
              - 'frontend/**'
              - 'package.json'
            backend:
              - 'backend/**'
              - 'api/**'
            docs:
              - 'docs/**'
              - '**.md'
  
  frontend-tests:
    name: Frontend Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: determine-changes
    if: needs.determine-changes.outputs.frontend == 'true'
    
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Run frontend tests
        run: npm run test:frontend
  
  backend-tests:
    name: Backend Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: determine-changes
    if: needs.determine-changes.outputs.backend == 'true'
    
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Run backend tests
        run: npm run test:backend
  
  docs-validation:
    name: Documentation Validation
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: determine-changes
    if: needs.determine-changes.outputs.docs == 'true'
    
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Validate documentation
        run: npm run docs:validate

troubleshooting.problem: Workflow not triggering on push to specific branch
troubleshooting.solution: Check branch name spelling and ensure the branch exists in the repository
troubleshooting.details: Verify branch names match exactly in workflow file and that the branch has been pushed to remote

troubleshooting.problem: Job failing with 'Resource not accessible by integration' error
troubleshooting.solution: Check workflow permissions and ensure the GITHUB_TOKEN has necessary scopes
troubleshooting.details: Add appropriate permissions block to workflow or use personal access token for elevated permissions

troubleshooting.solution: Verify secrets are properly set in repository settings and referenced correctly
troubleshooting.details: Ensure secrets are defined at the correct level (repository, environment, or organization)

troubleshooting.problem: Matrix build failing on specific combinations
troubleshooting.solution: Use 'continue-on-error' or exclude problematic combinations from matrix
troubleshooting.details: Some matrix combinations may be incompatible; handle them gracefully or exclude them

troubleshooting.solution: Optimize job dependencies, use caching, and parallel execution where possible
troubleshooting.details: Analyze workflow execution time and optimize bottlenecks; consider using self-hosted runners for heavy workloads
